title: Man grazed by bullet in Gage Park shooting
text:
A bullet grazed a 20-year-old manâ€™s shoulder in a Gage Park neighborhood shooting Sunday evening on the Southwest Side.
He was inside a vehicle at 7:08 p.m. in the 5200 block of South Homan when someone in a passing car started shooting, according to Chicago Police.
The man was taken to Holy Cross Hospital for the graze wound and his condition stabilized.
Sunday night, police were questioning a person of interest in the attack. Investigators think it was gang-related.
